page.title: 04DAY IN LIFE OF A PIG FARMER.
page.content: The day starts at six thirty a.m. when the pigs are fed and cleaned out. There are seventy sows, three boars and about five hundred fattening pigs. The sows have ten piglets on average, and farrow twice a year. Breakfast at eight thirty a.m. Before feeding and cleaning out again at four p.m. there are a variety of tasks to be done. The piglets are born in farrowing crates which help to stop the sows lying on the piglets. They are always watched at farrowing, day or night. At three days old the piglets are injected with iron and their teeth are cut, so that the sows do not get sore teats. The pigs are weaned at three weeks old. Once a week the fat pigs are weighed. If they are 60kg in weight, aged between 16 & 18 weeks, they are sold for pork. They are fed on bulk pelletted corn.
